Package ui.game

Class Piece

  • java.lang.Object
    • ui.drawing.DrawableSection
      • ui.input.selection.DrawableSelectableSection
        • ui.input.selection.DrawableSelectableBufferedSection<DrawableBufferedSection>
          • ui.game.Piece
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BufferedSection, PrintHandler, Section, SelectableBufferedSection, SelectableSection, SelectionHandler
    public class Piece
extends DrawableSelectableBufferedSection<DrawableBufferedSection>
    Represents a Piece in the game.
    Represents a drawable selectable buffered section.
    Represents a selectable section that can be drawn to the terminal window.
    Represents a section that can be drawn to the terminal window.

      • Piece

        public Piece​(boolean enabled,
             Piece piece,
             Game game)
        Constructor for Piece.
        Parameters:
        enabled - If the piece is enabled for selection.
        piece - The logic.Piece being represented.
        game - The game the piece belongs to.

    • Method Detail

      • unfocus

        protected void unfocus()
        Called whenever focus is lost (i.e. from moving to next selection).
        Specified by:
        unfocus in class DrawableSelectableSection

      • focus

        public KeyHandler focus​(KeyHandler current)
        Called when this element is focused. If no handler is defined or section is not enabled call parent's focus method. If no parent is defined return current key handler.
        Specified by:
        focus in interface SelectionHandler
        Overrides:
        focus in class DrawableSelectableSection
        Parameters:
        current - The current KeyHandler.
        Returns:
        The KeyHandler to return (normally this element's movement selection handler).

      • select

        public KeyHandler select​(KeyHandler current)
        Called when the user selects this element. In this case call the game's selectPiece method.
        Parameters:
        current - The current KeyHandler.
        Returns:
        The KeyHandler to return (could be a different key handler for e.g. entering text).

      • update

        public void update()
        Called before drawing the section. In this case pass to the underlying buffered section. In this case redraw the piece.
        Specified by:
        update in interface Section
        Overrides:
        update in class DrawableSelectableBufferedSection<DrawableBufferedSection>

      • redraw

        private void redraw()
        Renders the piece that is stored in the piece field. If this is null then the space is empty, but can still be selected. If there's a piece add its representation and move directions. Directions where the player can actually move are highlighter in the player's colour.

      • getPlayerColour

        private Colour getPlayerColour()
        Gets the current colour of the piece.
        Returns:
        The colour.

      • fill

        private void fill()
        Fills the piece with a set of coloured chars of either the unenabled, enabled, or focused background colour.

      • setPiece

        public void setPiece​(Piece piece,
                     boolean flipped)
        Set the logic.Piece of the space.
        Parameters:
        piece - The piece to set.
        flipped - Should the move directions be reversed.

      • getPiece

        public Piece getPiece()
        Getter for the logic.Piece.
        Returns:
        the piece.
